availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, liquor merchant. Native of Hanover, Germany. Married to Lizzie Jacobs Finck in Louisville on February 11, 1858. Father of six children. Master Mason in Willis Stewart Lodge. Founded the Western Insurance Bank and served as President. Helped establish the German-English Academy, the Orphans' Society, the Protestant German Orphan Asylum. Served as director of Southern Mutual Life Insurance Company.

ab.bibl:
Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 87.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, p. 64-65.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7007126, Louisville Deaths, p. 306-07.
“C. Henry Finck Dead,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), October 15, 1878, p. 4.
